orchestrator.goal: Integrate participant schedules and produce a joint PDDL planning domain and problem to find a 30 minute meeting slot on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits every participant.

public_information: Schedule a meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00
All participants must be available for the chosen 30 minute slot
Use FastDownward compatible PDDL for planning

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL problems targeted to the FastDownward planner. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the scheduling task. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Your name is Donald. You are in an environment with the following public information: Schedule a meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00. Meeting duration is 30 minutes. All participants must be available for the chosen 30 minute slot. Use FastDownward compatible PDDL for planning. You have the following knowledge: Monday 09:30-10:00, Monday 11:00-12:30, Monday 14:30-15:00, Monday 16:30-17:00. This is the global goal to solve: Schedule a 30 minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that works for all participants. Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that represent your availability and constraints. If some information is missing, do not assume it, only represent what you know. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems targeted to the FastDownward planner. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the integrated scheduling task. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If there are multiple agents, keep their actions distinct and integrate their constraints into a single solvable PDDL problem.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. There are six participant agents that will send you PDDL domains and problems representing their availabilities. Your task is to integrate the PDDL responses into a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem that finds a 30 minute meeting slot on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits every participant. Keep in mind that the PDDL they send may be partial or contain ambiguous names for the same time slots. Preserve distinct agent actions and constraints. Use FastDownward compatible PDDL and prefer simple numeric time or discrete slot encodings that FastDownward supports. Here is the PDDL received from the participants: pddl_donald, pddl_zachary, pddl_kathryn, pddl_deborah, pddl_teresa, pddl_james. Think step by step and provide an integrated PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that solves the global goal. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
